result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary J Friso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Gary J Friso in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gary J Friso in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Ms. Anderson motions the court for stay pending appeal of the balance of defendant's unserved sentences. If the Court grants the motion, defense asks that defendant be released on bond pending appeal. Defense then asks the Court to review the stay, if granted, in 60-90 days. The State objects without argument.

Defense asks that deft be given an additional 60 days to pay the balance of his fines.

BTC: Request to stay sentence pending appeal is denied. Defendant may have an additional 60 days to pay the balance of his fines.

correspondence via email from E.C. re: case, along with copy of email that may have been sent over a year ago to DA, Clerk of Court - copies made for file and defense attorney
Second Amended

Ct 1: 946.47(1)(b)-Harbor/Aiding a Felon; Ct 2: 961.573(1)-PDP; Ct 3: 946.41(1)-Resisting/Obstructing; Ct 4: 941.30(1)-1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety. No contact with the victim's family. No contact with the witness listed in the complaint. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Defendant is to live with his mother and follow ALL of his mother's house rules. Defendant's mother must report any violations to the Court. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 02/10/15   MOTHER IS NO LONGER NEEDED TO SUPERVISE/MONITOR DEFENDANT.

Defendant Gary J Friso in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Gary J Friso in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 05-06-2015/tk
Defense asks that cash be modified to $2,500.00 cash.  Defendant has no issue with GPS monitoring and no alc/cs with ZCI monitoring. The State objects to bond modification citing the current charges and the exposure deft is facing along with the fact that the bond request was brought back in May and was denied.

BTC: bond modification is granted. $2,500.00 cash - any terms and conditions previously imposed remain. No alc/cs-ZCI, Deft is allowed to stay with mother and must follow rules of her home. Mother is to report any violations to the Court.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
